intro: Verbascum aqranse, commonly known as the Aqranse mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems covered in soft, woolly hairs. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and also covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Verbascum aqranse is often found in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in full sun.
